ArticleTitle.sentence: A serum response element and a binding site for NF-Y mediate the serum response of the human thrombospondin 1 gene.

event.clue: A serum response element and a binding site for NF-Y mediate the serum response of the human thrombospondin 1 gene.
A serum response element and a binding site for NF-Y mediate the serum response of the human thrombospondin 1 gene.
A serum response element and a binding site for NF-Y mediate the serum response of the human thrombospondin 1 gene.

AbstractText.sentence: The expression of thrombospondin 1 (TSP 1), a member of the TSP gene family, is rapidly induced by growth factors.

event.clue: The expression of thrombospondin 1 (TSP 1), a member of the TSP gene family, is rapidly induced by growth factors.
The expression of thrombospondin 1 (TSP 1), a member of the TSP gene family, is rapidly induced by growth factors.

AbstractText.sentence: We tested the ability of human TSP 1-chloramphenicol acetyltransferase constructs to respond to serum in stably transfected NIH-3T3 cells.

event.clue: We tested the ability of human TSP 1-chloramphenicol acetyltransferase constructs to respond to serum in stably transfected NIH-3T3 cells.
We tested the ability of human TSP 1-chloramphenicol acetyltransferase constructs to respond to serum in stably transfected NIH-3T3 cells.
We tested the ability of human TSP 1-chloramphenicol acetyltransferase constructs to respond to serum in stably transfected NIH-3T3 cells.

AbstractText.sentence: Two transcriptional elements in the TSP 1 promoter, a distal element at -1280 and a proximal element at -65, were required for the response of the human TSP 1 gene to serum.

event.clue: Two transcriptional elements in the TSP 1 promoter, a distal element at -1280 and a proximal element at -65, were required for the response of the human TSP 1 gene to serum.
Two transcriptional elements in the TSP 1 promoter, a distal element at -1280 and a proximal element at -65, were required for the response of the human TSP 1 gene to serum.

AbstractText.sentence: The distal element contains the 5'-CC(A + T)6GG-3' consensus sequence characteristic of a serum-response element (SRE).
Deletions or mutations in this element reduced the serum response of the TSP 1 gene by 80-90%.

event.clue: Deletions or mutations in this element reduced the serum response of the TSP 1 gene by 80-90%.
Deletions or mutations in this element reduced the serum response of the TSP 1 gene by 80-90%.
Deletions or mutations in this element reduced the serum response of the TSP 1 gene by 80-90%.
Deletions or mutations in this element reduced the serum response of the TSP 1 gene by 80-90%.
Deletions or mutations in this element reduced the serum response of the TSP 1 gene by 80-90%.

AbstractText.sentence: In gel-shift assays, the -1280 element and the c-fos SRE cross-competed, whereas their functional and binding mutants did not.

event.clue: In gel-shift assays, the -1280 element and the c-fos SRE cross-competed, whereas their functional and binding mutants did not.

AbstractText.sentence: The proximal element contains the sequence 5'-GGCCAATGGG-3', which closely resembles the consensus binding motif for the CCAAT-binding factor NF-Y (CBF, CP1, alpha CP1).
Deletions or mutations in this element also reduced the serum response by 80-90%.

event.clue: Deletions or mutations in this element also reduced the serum response by 80-90%.
event.comment: NER: S7 T20 del "c-fos SRE cross"; ARTIFICIAL

event.clue: Deletions or mutations in this element also reduced the serum response by 80-90%.

AbstractText.sentence: Methylation interference analysis of the -65 region identified a pattern of contacts with nuclear factors resembling that for NF-Y, and an NF-Y-binding site and the proximal TSP 1 element cross-competed in gel-shift assays, whereas their binding mutants did not.

event.clue: Methylation interference analysis of the -65 region identified a pattern of contacts with nuclear factors resembling that for NF-Y, and an NF-Y-binding site and the proximal TSP 1 element cross-competed in gel-shift assays, whereas their binding mutants did not.

AbstractText.sentence: Finally, an abbreviated TSP 1 promoter/5'-flank, containing the SRE- and NF-Y-binding sites, mediated a serum response that was close in magnitude to that of the parent promoter.

event.clue: Finally, an abbreviated TSP 1 promoter/5'-flank, containing the SRE- and NF-Y-binding sites, mediated a serum response that was close in magnitude to that of the parent promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: We conclude that the serum response of the human TSP 1 gene requires the coordinated function of an SRE- and NF-Y-binding site.

event.clue: We conclude that the serum response of the human TSP 1 gene requires the coordinated function of an SRE- and NF-Y-binding site.
We conclude that the serum response of the human TSP 1 gene requires the coordinated function of an SRE- and NF-Y-binding site.
